column2: type identifier is «abstract» «tagged» «limited» [recordfieldname1 : type;fieldname2 : type;...end record null record]
column4: Any combination of records, unions and enumerations (as well as references to those, enabling recursive types).
column5: type identifier (variation : discrete_type) is recordcase variation iswhen choice_list1 =>fieldname1 : type;...when choice_list2 =>fieldname2 : type;......end case;end record

column3: align=center Required types and operators can be user defined

column4: enum name { case Foo«(types)» case Bar «(types)» ... }

column2: Structure name  Dim name As type  ...  End Structure
TYPE name   type ::  name  ...  END TYPE

column4: abstract class namecase class Foo(«parameters») extends namecase class Bar(«parameters») extends name... or abstract class namecase object Foo extends namecase object Bar extends name... or combination of case classes and case objects

column7: type name = Foo «of type»  Bar «of type»  ...
datatype name = Foo «of type»  Bar «of type»  ...

column2: level-number name type clauses.  level-number+n name type clauses.  ...
